==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|ぶ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=けいぶ}} {{m|zh|輕侮|tr=khjieng mju<sup>X</sup>|lit=light (not heavy) + insult}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|輕侮|qīngwǔ|to insult}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けいぶ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|けいぶ}}

# [[disdain]], [[contempt]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''軽侮'''の目で見る|'''けいぶ''' の め で みる|to look on something with '''disdain'''}}

====Usage notes====
The term {{lang|ja|軽侮}} (''keibu'') is somewhat less strong than the synonym {{m|ja|軽蔑|tr=keibetsu}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|軽蔑|けいべつ}}: [[scorn]]

====Antonyms====
* {{ja-r|崇敬|すうけい}}: [[reverence]]

===Verb===

# to [[disdain]] something, to [[scorn]] something
